definition: abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)

sentences.english: He brought the subject to those who were agitating for a raise in their company.
sentences.chinese: 他把话题转移到公司里闹着要加薪的那帮人身上。

sentences.english: There is a raise after three months probation period according to your performance.
sentences.chinese: 三个月的试用期过后，将根据工作表现加薪。

sentences.english: These increases taper off after a time, though, unless they enter management.
sentences.chinese: 过了一段时间后加薪会逐渐减少，除非进入管理层。

sentences.english: His tightfisted employer was unwilling to give him a raise.
sentences.chinese: 他那吝啬的雇主不肯给他加薪。

sentences.english: Therefore, It is now not neccessary to think about the problem of salary increase.
sentences.chinese: 所以，现在不要想着这个加薪的问题。

sentences.english: The union has balloted its members in pursuit of a pay claim.
sentences.chinese: 为了要求加薪，工会让其成员进行无记名投票表决。

sentences.english: Ricky asked his boss for a raise.
He needed some Dutch courage before facing his boss about the pay increase.
sentences.chinese: 他需要喝点酒壮壮胆，才能当老板的面谈加薪的事。

sentences.english: Wage hikes boost costs but might help sales.
sentences.chinese: 加薪提高了成本，但是促进了消费。

sentences.english: Eg. He was browned off at his boss because he didn't get a raise.
sentences.chinese: 他因为没有获得加薪而生老板的气。

sentences.english: And they go to their boss every year and get a raise because they've done that.
sentences.chinese: 他们每年也会以此向老板邀功并获得加薪。

sentences.english: But do you dare ask for a raise now, in a waning economy?
sentences.chinese: 那么，在这样的经济紧张时期，你是否敢要求加薪呢？

sentences.english: At many jobs, in order to get a raise, employees need to go above and beyond the basic requirements.
sentences.chinese: 很多职业都是这样，员工想加薪，必须超额完成任务。

sentences.english: That's why we are re-instituting salary increases.
sentences.chinese: 这就是我们重新提出加薪的原因。

sentences.english: Lower-wage workers would get a bump in pay.
sentences.chinese: 工资较低的工人会得到加薪。

definition: to receive a raise in salary
to get a better job somewhere else (idiom)/to seek alternative employment
to retire/to leave office/to quit a job
